name: Lemon Barley Stuffing
description: Grain stuffings are an elegant alternative to bread stuffing on the Thanksgiving table, and one that happens to work well for any gluten-avoiding guests. Here the barley is tossed with roasted shiitake mushrooms, chive butter, hazelnuts and plenty of lemon to zip it up. Stuff it in the turkey if you'd like, or serve it alongside as a supple, addictive dressing.
recipeYield: 9 cups, enough to stuff a 10- to 12-pound turkey
keywords: barley, lemon, shiitake, gluten-free, side dish
recipeIngredient: 2 leeks, white and light-green part only, finely chopped
1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, more to taste
1 1/4 pounds shiitake mushroom caps, sliced 1/4-inch thick
1 cup toasted, peeled hazelnuts, coarsely chopped
Finely grated zest of 1 small lemon plus one teaspoon freshly squeezed lemon juice, more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large pot, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add leeks and cook, stirring, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add barley and rosemary sprig; cook 1 minute more. Pour in the stock, 1 1/2 cups water and 3/4 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil over high heat; reduce heat, cover and simmer until barley is tender and most liquid has evaporated, about 1 hour 15 minutes. Check it after an hour. If it is tender but liquid is not absorbed, drain barley in a strainer. Or if liquid has evaporated and barley is still not tender, add a little more water and continue cooking until it is.

Meanwhile, toss mushrooms with oil, 3/4 teaspoon salt and  3/4 teaspoon pepper. Spread in a single layer on two large baking sheets. Roast, tossing occasionally, until tender and beginning to crisp around edges, 20 to 25 minutes.

Make chive butter: In a mortar and pestle or mini food processor, mash together the garlic and salt until it forms a paste. Stir in the lemon zest and juice until salt dissolves. Pound or pulse in the chives, then stir in the butter until incorporated.
Spoon hot barley into a large bowl. Stir in mushrooms, hazelnuts, parsley and chive butter until well combined. Taste and add more salt and lemon if necessary.
